intro: Prunella vulgaris f. erubescens, commonly known as the red-flowered self-heal, is a variant of the common self-heal plant. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 15–30 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and its most distinguishing characteristic is its clusters of bright red or pink flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
